gurmukhi: XO kih BUpiq pwrQ kau rn Dwie pirE kr lY As pYnw ] sYn inhwr mhwblu Dwr hkwr pirE mn rMck BY nw ]
transliteration: Yau Kah(i) Bhoopat(i) Paarath Kau Ran Dhaae Pario Kar Lai As Painaa|| Sain Nihaar Mahaabal(u) Dhaar Hakaar Pario Man Ranchak Bhai Naa||
translation: Saying these words to Arjuna, and taking up his sharp sword in his hand, the king fell upon the army; seeing towards the army, he, the mighty one, becoming completely fearless, challenged the army;

gurmukhi: S`qRn ky Asvwn gey Cut koaU sikE kir AwXuD lYnw ] mwr Anyk dey rn mY iek pwnI hI pwnI rtY kir sYnw ]1624]
transliteration: Shattran Ke Asvaan Gad Chhout Ko( i)  Sakio Kar(i) Aayudh Lainaa|| Maar Anek Dae Ran Mai Ik Paanihiratai Kar(i) Sainaa||1624||
translation: Seeing him, the enemies become fearful; they could not hold their weapons; he killed many in the war and the whole army shouted ‘water, water.’1624.

gurmukhi: BjI sYn jb pwNfvI kiRSn iblokI nYn ] durXoDn so XoN khI qum Dwvhu lY sYn ]1625]
transliteration: Bhajisain Jab Paandavikrishan Bilokinain|| Duryodhan So Yon Kahitoum Dhaavoh Lai Sain||1625||
translation: When Krishna saw the Pandava army running away, he asked Duryodhana to attack.1625.

gurmukhi: XoN suin kY hir kI bqIAw sij kY durjoDn sYn isDwrXo ] BIKm AwgY BXo sMg Bwnju dRox kiRpwidj swQ pDwrXo ]
transliteration: Yon Soun(i) Kai Har(i) Kibateeaa Saj(i) Kai Durjodhan Sain Sidhdaryo|| Bhikham Aagad Bhayo San Bhaanaj(u) Dron Kridaadij Saath Padhdaryo||
translation: Hearing the words of Krishna, Duryodhana marched forward with his bedecked army; there were Bhishma, Dronacharya, Kripacharya etc. with Karana,

gurmukhi: Dwie pry Arrwie sBY iqh BUpq so Aiq hI rn pwrXo ] Awgy huie BUp lirE n firE sB kau sr eyk hI eyk pHwrXo ]1626]
transliteration: Dhaae Dare Ar-raae Sabhai Tih Bhoopat So At(i) Hiran Pdaryo Ooge Hue Bhoop Lario Na Dario Sabh Kau Sr Ek Hiek Prahdaryo||1626||
translation: And all these mighty ones waged a dreadful war with the king Kharag Singh; the fought fearlessly advancing forward and he discharged one arrow towards each.1626.

gurmukhi: qb BIKm kop kIE mn mY ieh BUpiq pY bhu qIr clwey ] Awvq bwn so bwn kty KVgyS mhw As lY kir Dwey ]
transliteration: Tab Bhikham Kop Keeo Man Mai Eh Bhoopat(i) Pai Bahu Teer Chadhaae|| Oovat Baan So Baan Kate Khadgesh Mahaa As Lai Kar(i) Dhaae||
translation: Then Bhishma got infuriated and discharged many arrows towards king; who intercepting all these arrows ran forward with his sword;

gurmukhi: hoq BXo qh ju`Du bfo iris BIKm ky niRp bYn sunwey ] qau liKho hmry bl kau jb hI jm ky bis hoN giH jwey ]1627]
transliteration: Hot Bhayo Tah Juddh(u) Bado Ris(i) Bheekham Ke Nrip Bain Sounaae|| Tau Lakhiho Hamre Bal Kau Jab Hijam Ke Bas(i) Hon Grah(i) Jaae||1627||
translation: In that dreadful war, the king said within the hearing of Bhiashma: ‘You will only know my power, when you reach the abode of Yama.’1627.

gurmukhi: Bjq n BIKm ju`D qy BUp lKI ieh gwQ ] sIs kitE iqh sUq ko eyk bwn ky swQ ]1628]
transliteration: Bhajat Na Bheekham Juddh Te Bhoop Lakhieh Gadth|| Sees Katio Tih Soot Ko Ek Baan Ke Saath||1628||
translation: Kharag Singh saw that Bhishma was not running away from the war, he cut down the head of the charioteer of Bhishma with a single arrow.1628.

gurmukhi: AsÍ ly BIKm ko Bijgy qb hI durjoDn kop BirE ] sMg dRaux ko puqR kiRpw br lY brmw kiRq jwdv jwie pirE ]
transliteration: Asv Le Bheekhan Ko Bhaj(i)ge Tab Hidurjodhan Kop Bhario|| San Draoun Ko Poutra Kridaa Bar Lai Barmaa Krit Jaadav Jaae Pario||
translation: Taking Bhishma (in the chariot), the horses ran away, then Duryodhana was filled with anger; he fell upon the king alongwith the son of Dronacharya, Kripacharya, Kratavarma and Yadavas etc.;
